intro: Chaetogastra alata, commonly known as the winged chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
